title: Laying the groundwork
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: Marketing has invested $250,000 for this year to build new content. Let's take a look at the data to answer the questions.
learning_objective: Get the right time, index, sourcetype, and to understand that there are crucial information in the fields

phrasings.question_phrasing: Looking at July of this year, Which field in the lendur_web index marketing:access sourcetype looks to contain the names of the content that marketing has developed/published?
phrasings.answer_guidance: There are multiple answers. Just enter one of them.
phrasings.learning_objective: Get the right time, index, sourcetype, and to understand that there are crucial information in the fields

hints.hint: Look for the field that has the article heloc-home-equity-line-of-credit-explained

phrasings.question_phrasing: Looking at July of this year, Which fields in the lendur_web index marketing:access sourcetype contain the names of the content that marketing has developed/published? A) index, sourcetype, host B) file, method, referer C) file, uri, uri_path D) uri, uri_path, uri_query
phrasings.learning_objective: Get the right time, index, sourcetype, and to understand that there are crucial information in the fields

hints.hint: Look for the field that has the article heloc-home-equity-line-of-credit-explained

title: Laying the groundwork
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: Marketing has invested $250,000 for this year to build new content. Let's take a look at the data to answer the questions.
learning_objective: Understand that the referer field is linked with the articles

phrasings.question_phrasing: The field you found in Question 1 has a lot of other data in it. There is another field you can use to help narrow down the content to only focus on the marketing content. Which field will help narrow down the marketing content?
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand that the referer field is linked with the articles

hints.hint: Look for marketing in a field

phrasings.question_phrasing: The field you found in Question 1 has a lot of other data in it. Which field will help narrow down the marketing content? A) referer B) uri C) method D) clientip
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand that the referer field is linked with the articles

hints.hint: Look for marketing in a field

title: Laying the groundwork
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: Marketing has invested $250,000 for this year to build new content. Let's take a look at the data to answer the questions.
learning_objective: Understand that the referer field has marketing data you can use to filter

phrasings.question_phrasing: The field you found in Question 2 also has a lot of other data in it like redirects and data from the portal.lendurmortgage.com. After you remove those events from your search, you will be left with marketing content and landing pages. Name one of the values (in that field from question 2) that contains marketing data.
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand that the referer field has marketing data you can use to filter

hints.hint: Filter out redirects AND portal.lendurmortgage.com from your search
Look for the word marketing in a particular field

phrasings.question_phrasing: The field you found in Question 2 also has a lot of other data in it like redirects and data from the portal.lendurmortgage.com. After you remove those events from your search, you will be left with marketing content and landing pages. Which one of the following is a name of the values (in that field from question 2) that contains marketing data? A) /purchase-marketing B) /funding-marketing C) /refinance D) /newloan-marketing
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand that the referer field has marketing data you can use to filter

hints.hint: Filter out redirects AND portal.lendurmortgage.com from your search
Look for the word marketing in a particular field

title: Starting the analysis
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: This project launched this year, the following questions will help guide the gamer to do the analysis
learning_objective: Understand how many existing articles Lendur had

phrasings.question_phrasing: Now, combining the knowledge you've discovered in the first couple of questions, how many articles were available on the website in February of this year?
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand how many existing articles Lendur had

phrasings.question_phrasing: Now, combining the knowledge you've discovered in the first couple of questions, how many articles were available on the website in February of this year? A) 7 B) 9 C) 11 D)13

title: Starting the analysis
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: This project launched this year, the following questions will help guide the gamer to do the analysis
learning_objective: Understand how many new articles Lendur had created

phrasings.question_phrasing: How many articles were available on the website in August of this year?
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand how many new articles Lendur had created

phrasings.question_phrasing: How many articles were available on the website in August of this year? A) 11 B) 35 C) 66 D) Too many
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand how many new articles Lendur had created

title: Performing the analysis
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: This project launched this year. When did it launch?
learning_objective: Understand when was the project launched. Instead of going to look for some spreadsheet or project plan, we can use Splunk to determine change

phrasings.question_phrasing: In which month from Year To Date was there a change in the amount of articles?
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand when was the project launched. Instead of going to look for some spreadsheet or project plan, we can use Splunk to determine change

hints.hint: Make sure timerange is set to Year To Date and set span to month
Look at the new articles found in the previous question. See if they exist in all of the months. If they don't exist, that'll give you an idea of what the change happened.

phrasings.question_phrasing: In which month from Year To Date was there a change in the amount of articles? A) February B) December C) April D) May
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand when was the project launched. Instead of going to look for some spreadsheet or project plan, we can use Splunk to determine change

hints.hint: Make sure timerange is set to Year To Date and set span to month
Look at the new articles found in the previous question. See if they exist in all of the months. If they don't exist, that'll give you an idea of what the change happened.

title: Performing the analysis
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: The goal for funding of the new marketing content is to increase the conversions of prospects. First, it would be good to understand what the old conversion was. Look in February of this year. The way to identify if the client was a conversion is to ensure that the client looked started in the marketing articles and clicked to the get started page.
learning_objective: Understand how we can create business metrics from normal IT type data

phrasings.question_phrasing: What was the conversion for January of this year?
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand how we can create business metrics from normal IT type data

hints.hint: There are multiple ways to solve this. You can run two separate searches and manually calculate. You can use append. I'm sure there are others
Look for the phrase *get-started* in the events. This will signify when a user starts an application
When counting clients, use the clientip field and make sure you distinctly count them

phrasings.question_phrasing: What was the conversion for January of this year? A) 10.51 B) 14.31 C) 19.83 D) 24.31
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand how we can create business metrics from normal IT type data

hints.hint: There are multiple ways to solve this. You can run two separate searches and manually calculate. You can use append. I'm sure there are others
Look for the phrase *get-started* in the events. This will signify when a user starts an application
When counting clients, use the clientip field and make sure you distinctly count them

description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.answer_guidance: Simple yes or no will suffice

title: Performing the analysis
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

title: Performing the analysis
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
learning_objective: Understand we can trend on these metrics

phrasings.question_phrasing: Between March and July, the AVC had a substantial change, what day did Lendur see the increase in AVC?
phrasings.answer_guidance: Make sure you answer with the day that had the increase in the format mmdd (e.g. 0713 for July 13th)
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand we can trend on these metrics

phrasings.question_phrasing: Between March and July, the AVC had a substantial change, what day did Lendur see the increase in AVC? A) February 29th B) April 1st C) May 1st D) June 29th
phrasings.answer_guidance: Make sure you answer with the day that had the increase in the format mmdd (e.g. 0713 for July 13th)
phrasings.learning_objective: Understand we can trend on these metrics

title: Time for the money maker questions
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?
background: Now the ultimate goal for Lendur is to obviously gain additional revenue by closing loans. We can gauge how many loans were approved since we have the data. Look for the data in August of this year and calculate how many loans were approved. Lendur calculates profit of $1500 per loan approved.

phrasings.question_phrasing: What is the profit for August?
What is the profit for August? A) $100,250 B) 1,501,750 C) 4,010,080 D) 5,032,500

title: Worth it?
description: we don't use description, I wonder where this shows up?

phrasings.question_phrasing: The total cost of this project was $750,000. Was this a good investment?
phrasings.answer_guidance: A simple yes or no will suffice.
